definition[0]: an amount or share of something such as money or time that is given to someone or something, or the process of doing this
example[0]: The budget allotment for each county is below what is needed.
example[1]: the allotment of shares in the company
definition[1]: a small area of land that people can rent for growing vegetables
definition[2]: an amount or share of something such as money or time that is given to a person or organization
example[2]: They argued that they needed their full allotment of vacation days as the job is very stressful.
definition[3]: the number of shares allocated to each possible buyer when new shares are first made available
example[3]: Investors may wish to buy more than the 9 million share allotment.
